item.description:
I am pleased to annoucnce this groundbreaking meetup which is a collaboration between the  local decluttering meetup group, run by Judy Stitt, and our NLP group. If you want to see NLP at work for compuslions such as Cluttering, join us on this on.  It should be great.

Description: This next Meetup greatly excites me -- and offers a wonderful framework in which to study this group's past four months without a meeting as a case study of "cluttered thinking" -- offering a quick and simple solution to challenges many of us face:  because the project of scheduling our upcoming workshop, which had been so close to my heart, did NOT get done for months -- because the task of finding an optimal venue (rent-free or inexpensive restaurant, convenient for those who drive as well as those who do not, sufficiently low noise level to minimize distraction) blocked the process ... which became overwhelming when issues arose concerning each of my several preferred venue options so that I turned ("for now") to projects on which I knew I could progress more easily (taking paths of least resistance -- including decluttering my own home!) ... making it abundantly clear to us all now how procrastination can be an issue for me, when left to my own devices -- as it may be for many of you, too (In fact-- I will take this opportunity to invite you to join me in helping to prevent a repeat scenario of this past few months by contributing to our group as assistant organizer, offering whatever you wish to share -- including opportunities to organize meetings or workshops of special interest to you ... more personal interaction with other members, especially assistant organizers, helps me better focus on scheduling more regularly programs of interest to all -- helping us to make better headway in overcoming the issues of clutter and "cluttered thinking" that we all face to some degree).

 

AGENDA:

7:00 - 7:15 pm:  Intro to NLP (history, fundamentals?) -- Neurolinguistic programming (NLP):  A series of lessons that teach what others have learned works to effect change -- desired results -- most rapidly (adapted from Richard Bandler, Get the Life You Want)

7:15 - 7:30 pm - Roots of clutter (cluttered thinking? difficulty w/ decisions? seeing value in too much?)

7:30 - 8:00 pm – Examples of techniques that can help

8:00 - 8:30 pm - Demo(s?)

8:30 - 8:45 pm - Q & A

8:45 - 9:00 pm - Wrap-up

 

PREVIEW OF COMING ATTRACTIONS:  You can get a feel for NLP and different techniques used.

 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UwxvUofenC4

Steve Andreas on Compulsions

 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UegIujmGUiY&feature=channel

Robert Smith using EFT on Procrstination

 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8vlcsFJyEXQ

Richard Bandler on NLP

 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PBNoefm5_i4&NR=1&feature=fvwp

Robert Smith on tapping
item.how_to_find_us: We will be in the back of bertuccis

group.name: The Greater Boston NLP and Hypnosis Meetup Group

item.name: DECLUTTER FAST: Getting over the Cluttering Issue with NLP
